info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:19PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 1019 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rye, or 8 miles southwest of Payson, moving north at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Payson, Star Valley, Payson Airport, Round Valley, Oxbow Estates, Mesa Del Caballo, East Verde Estates, Flowing Springs, Freedom Acres, Gisela, Ellison Creek Cascades, Water Wheel Falls, Rye, Geronimo Estates, Whispering Pines, Washington Park, Tonto Village, Pine, Mead Ranch and Mazatzal Peak.
This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 252 and 268. State Route 87 southbound between mile markers 241 and 251. State Route 87 between mile markers 237 and 263.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Geronimo Boy Scout Camp, Ponderosa Campground, Houston Mesa Campground, Rumsey Park and Green Valley Park.
This includes the following swimming holes... Water Wheel Falls and Ellison Creek Cascades.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT YAVAPAI AND COCONINO COUNTIES UNTIL 1045 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County
